body:
- #2497: Shouldn’t validate content type if there is no content
- #2508: Masked use of `__NSCFBoolean` private API

name: Xcode 8 migration
body:
This release includes a major migration of the project in order to support Xcode 8.
Many of the internal dependencies have been updated and Travis-CI builds are finally fully operational again.

Also, this release includes a major bug fix related to iOS 10.x:

- #2449: Use explicit `userInfo` keys for `NSManagedObjectContextDidSaveNotification`

From #2434:
- Removed `iOS 5` related code in `RKPathUtilities.m`
- Increased deployment target to `iOS 8.0` and `OS X 10.9` on both project and test apps
- Updated rakefile: fixed `build:examples` task
- ~~Allowed warnings on `pod lib lint` (due to `AFNetworking`)~~
- Fixed `AFNetworking` reachability issue with `Cocoapods` `use_frameworks!`
- Fixed headers not found issue with `Cocoapods` > `0.38.2`
- Moved `RKHTTPUtilities` into Network directory
- Updated example projects pod files
- Removed `AFNetworking` dependency from podspec
- Renamed all `AFNetworking` classes to `AFRK` to be able to install any version of `AFNetworking` meanwhile using `RestKit`.

name: RestKit v0.24.1
body:
This is a maintenance release focused on continued bug fixed and improvements.
- Change the RKPropertyInspector cache writeback to use dispatch_barrier_sync
  [carllindberg](https://github.com/carllindberg)
- Added query parameters to the mapping metadata
  [wainglaister](https://github.com/wainglaister)
- Fixed mapping with a `nil` source key path
  [Valerio Mazzeo](https://github.com/valeriomazzeo)

name: v0.24.0
body:
This release focuses on some major performance improvements contributed by [@carllindberg](https://github.com/carllindberg), as well as enforcing stricter compliance with CoreData's thread confinement model.

This release also sees the minimum supported iOS version being increased to `5.1.1`.
- Don't log potentially sensitive information at Error/Warning/Info log levels  
  [Jason Sadler](https://github.com/sadlerjw)
- Fix CoreData thread confinement violations  
  [Blake Watters](https://github.com/blakewatters)
  [Patrick Pierson](https://github.com/ppierson)
- Bridging to other log systems is now possible  
  [carllindberg](https://github.com/carllindberg)
  [Ernesto Rivera](https://github.com/rivera-ernesto)

name: RestKit v0.23.3
body:
### Maintenance

This is a small maintenance update that focuses on several crucial improvements to core RestKit functionality, in addition to incremental improvements on the modularization front. The RestKit Core team welcomes [Valerio Mazzeo](https://github.com/valeriomazzeo), who was the driving force behind this release.

### Changelog
- Fix equivalence tests for request and response descriptors [Alex Leigh](https://github.com/alexleigh)
- Provide a single entry point for retrieving the fetch requests from the fetch request blocks [Valerio Mazzeo](https://github.com/valeriomazzeo) [#1995](https://github.com/RestKit/RestKit/issues/1995)
- Implemented indexing on NSArray of NSString and NSNumber [Valerio Mazzeo](https://github.com/valeriomazzeo)
- Allow for the Testing and CoreData subspecs without the Search subspec [Samuel E. Giddins](https://github.com/segiddins) [#1987](https://github.com/RestKit/RestKit/issues/1987)
- Extended RKObjectMappingMatcher capabilities with a RKKeyPathClassObjectMappingMatcher class [Valerio Mazzeo](https://github.com/valeriomazzeo)

name: RestKit v0.23.2
body:
# Maintenance

This is a maintenance release that brings incremental updates to modularization and various facets of the RestKit architecture.

# Changelog
- Honor passed in sqlite options when creating persistent store
- Make more functions work in `.mm` files [Romain Criton](https://github.com/mobiware)
- Fix RKMappingOperation skipping validation when data source tells it to set unchanged values [Coneko](https://github.com/Coneko)
- Prefer the use RKAttributeMapping value transformers if provided [Kamil Kocemba](https://github.com/FWKamil)
- Copy `RKObjectMapping. sourceToDestintationKeyTransformationBlock` [Ian G](https://github.com/yoiang)
- Make `RestKit.h` importable with stand-alone subspecs [Samuel Giddins](https://github.com/segiddins)
- Add rudimentary dynamic mapping equivalence [Jason Peebles](https://github.com/peebsjs)
- Switch to a vendored SOCKit version for manual installation
- Memoization of `RKResponseDescriptor`'s path matcher [Karl Gluck](https://github.com/karlgluck)
- Removed hidden `Support` dependency upon AFNetworking

name: RestKit v0.23.1
body:
# Modernization & Maintenance

This release updates RestKit to fix warnings under Xcode 5.1 and transitions off of deprecated technologies such as XCTest.

# Changelog
- Replaced numerous uses of `NSAssert` with `NSException` where appropriate
- Update project to build for arm64 on iOS targets
  [Matt Magoffin](https://github.com/msqr)
  [#1677](https://github.com/RestKit/RestKit/issues/1677)
- Improved handling for response codes with optional bodies
  [#1686](https://github.com/RestKit/RestKit/pull/1686)
- Prevented deletion of managed objects if a response mapper error is encountered
  [Konstantin Novikov](https://github.com/novkostya)
  [#1695](https://github.com/RestKit/RestKit/issues/1695)
- Improved checking around Etags
  [#1599](https://github.com/RestKit/RestKit/issues/1599)
- Ensured MOC isn't saved when an error is mapped
- Set proper error in `RKMappingOperation`
  [Ian G](https://github.com/yoiang)
- Use custom date formatter on attribute mapping when available
  [Freddie Tilley](https://github.com/freddietilley)
- Allowed each subspec to be used standalone
  [Samuel E. Giddins](https://github.com/segiddins)
  [#1770](https://github.com/RestKit/RestKit/issues/1770)

name: Modernization & Maintenance
body: This release updates RestKit to fix warnings under Xcode 5.1 and transitions off of deprecated technologies such as XCTest.

name: RestKit v0.20.3
body:
Released: **July 12, 2013**  
[Install via CocoaPods](): 

``` ruby
pod 'RestKit', '~> 0.20.0'
```

We are very pleased to announce the immediate availability of RestKit 0.20.3. This was a quick release that focused on fixing several high priority bugs and introduced several new feature enhancements in the network layer.

## Release Details

The full details of all features and fixes present in the release are available on Github…
- [v0.20.3 Milestone](https://github.com/RestKit/RestKit/issues?milestone=21&state=closed)
- [Comparison to v0.20.2](https://github.com/RestKit/RestKit/compare/v0.20.2...v0.20.3)
- [Browse v0.20.3 Sources](https://github.com/RestKit/RestKit/tree/0.20.3)
- [API Docs](http://restkit.org/api/0.20.3)

## Release Highlights

The 0.20.3 release contains a blend of bug fixes and feature enhancements. Highlights of the release include:
- Improvements to the `modificationAttribute` logic. A modification attribute can be designated on an `RKEntityMapping` to accelerate mapping of large payloads by intelligently detecting changes on a per object basis. [(Issue #1391)](https://github.com/RestKit/RestKit/issues/1391)
- Fixed memory leaks in `RKOperationStateMachine`. [(Issue #1404)](https://github.com/RestKit/RestKit/issues/1404)
- Added support for mapping the `@parent` and `@root` pseudo-key-paths. This enhancement provides for upward traversal of representations at mapping time, greatly enhancing mapping flexibility. Big thanks to @percysnoodle on this one. [(Issue #1435)](https://github.com/RestKit/RestKit/issues/1435)
- Added support for custom data source implementations in the network layer. [(Issue #1442)](https://github.com/RestKit/RestKit/issues/1442)
- Added support for using `RKRequestMethod` as a bitmask in routing. [(Issue #1476)](https://github.com/RestKit/RestKit/issues/1476)
- Added support for using `RKReqeustMethod` bitmask values in `RKRequestDescriptor` and `RKResponseDescriptor`. [(Issue #1482)](https://github.com/RestKit/RestKit/issues/1482)
- Added support for intelligently mapping additional objects in a payload by eliminating reliance on `targetObject` in `RKMapperOperation`. [(Issue #1309)](https://github.com/RestKit/RestKit/issues/1309)

## Contributors

A special thanks to these contributors during the 0.20.3 release:
- @segiddins
- @flambert
- @valeriomazzeo
- @percysnoodle
- @sixten
- @dulaccc
